channel.title: 30 minutes for home teleport
channel.description:
Just a question I have. When you click Home Teleport, you must wait 30 minutes to cast it again. Does this still continue when you log out or do you still have to wait the rest of the minutes when you log back in.
Example: I use home teleport. - I now have to wait 30 minutes to use it again. I stayed on the server for 3 minutes, then I logged off.
If I log back in 50 minutes later, do I still have to wait 27 minutes or can I use the home teleport right away?

item.title: 30 minutes for home teleport
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

joda-time api is another option.

You can set the time when the spell is cast and then use

Minutes.minutesBetween(dateOne, dateTwo).getMinutes() % 60

to get the minutes between the two dates.

The second date can be set to your liking. You could even set it 30 minutes later than the casting time.

Read full topic

item.title: 30 minutes for home teleport
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:5, topic:534309”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=653103.msg4376263#msg4376263 date=1382136433]

I believe it’s 30 minutes from last cast.
Meaning You teleport, and log off for 20 minutes, and come back, you now have to wait 10 minutes.
I’m not sure though.

Home teleport was originally introduced on 27 September 2006 in the Skill Tutors update.[1] The spell was added to all available spellbooks.[2] A player could cast the spell to return to Lumbridge (normal spellbook), Burthorpe (normal spellbook), Edgeville (Ancient Magicks), or Lunar Isle (Lunar Magicks). When first introduced, the spell required a 30 minute cooldown between teleports. This was removed in a hidden update on 28 March 2011.

That’s from the RS wiki, http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Home_Teleport

Damnit, makes programming this thing harder.
[/quote]Yea lol u’d have to keep a task running even if the player isnt online fudge that.[/quote]
Or, I mean, you could use this awesome thing called Calendar…

Read full topic

item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

twins:

bro’ why dont u test it?

Because they removed it in March of 2011 and I don’t have a 2007rs account.
